tweets.html:
If you're a fan of the words "friggin" and "crap" there's a 'Sopranos' marathon on A&E

— Eli Braden (@EliBraden) June 24, 2012

Samson's hair was the source of his strength. The source of mine is hating Modern Family.

— Marvel's Infinity Waco (@johnwarrender) June 24, 2012

Watching a movie where Poppy Montgomery plays "fat" by wearing a fat suit. She looks like Poppy Montgomery in a fat suit.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 24, 2012

If THE RIFLEMAN were made now, instead of "Go in the house, Mark," Lucas would say, "Shit's about to get real."

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) June 24, 2012

#Suits provides so much joy every single week. I can't take it anymore.

— nathan reinhart (@nathanrrr) June 24, 2012

"Five Hour Energy: Hours and Hours of Energy. Like, Between Four and Seven Hours. Closer to Four Hours, Maybe, Than Seven." #FirstDraftAds

— Ken Tremendous (@KenTremendous) June 24, 2012

The only thing worse than 2BG's racial stereotype 'comedy' is the audience who clap-laugh at the racial stereotype 'comedy'.

— Faye Woods (@FayebellineW) June 24, 2012

"Louie" is a weak show and isn't brilliant at all. [This tweet is untrue, but I didn't want to be predictable.]

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) June 24, 2012

I really want Breaking Bad to end with Saul Goodman being appointed to the U.S. Supreme Court.

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) June 25, 2012

GAME OF THRONES has "sexposition." Is there a term for the expository scenes in TRUE BLOOD that DON'T involve sex?

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) June 25, 2012

@poniewozik suxposition?

— Ignacio Esains (@Fichinescu) June 25, 2012

I think we have a winner. #TrueBloodNonSexScenesName RT @Fichinescu suxposition?

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) June 25, 2012

Alex Trebek suffered a heart attack but doesn't appear to be entering the Final Jeopardy Round (if you know what I mean.)

— Nell Scovell (@NellSco) June 25, 2012

Alex Trebek had a heart attack. I'm gonna be mad if at least one article about it isn't titled "Who Had a Heart Attack?"

— Mike Leffingwell (@mikeleffingwell) June 25, 2012

"What's wrong with the TV?". My wife at the beginning of every HBO show.

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) June 25, 2012

Critics probably would have liked #Newsroom better if Megan Hilty got the newscaster role.

— (((Andrew Rabin)))üìé (@arrabin56) June 24, 2012

Finally watched Newsroom pilot. Loved everything except stuff I absolutely fucking despised.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) June 24, 2012

#TheWestWing was good, right? I'm not dreaming that? Reviews for #Newsroom are making me question everything.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) June 24, 2012

Would love to see a Fox version of #thenewsroom where they decide the right thing to do is have blonde women scaring people 24 hours a day

— Downtown Josh Brown (@ReformedBroker) June 25, 2012

Finally, a highly anticipated big budget show about an opinionated rich white dude. About time, American pop culture!

— Chloe Angyal (@ChloeAngyal) June 25, 2012

Ah, and now we've got to the "critics reviewing other critics' reviews" stage of the NEWSROOM Crisis. Nap-time!

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) June 25, 2012

So the critics say this is the BEST episode of the series? I SERIOUSLY CANNOT WAIT FOR IT TO BECOME MORE BALONEY THAN THIS!!!! #thenewsroom

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) June 25, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
You know which generation is the worst? The one that worries about labeling generations. #FUSorkin #TheNewsroom

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) June 25, 2012

Walk and Talk! First Walk and Talk! #Sorkin #TheNewsroom

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) June 25, 2012

news make man angry grrrrr! #thenewsroom

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) June 25, 2012

YELLING! YELLING! SO MUCH YELLING! #Newsroom

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) June 25, 2012

Newsmen have screaming fights; newsgirls have boy problems! #thenewsroom

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) June 25, 2012

Wake me up when Jane Fonda's character on #TheNewsroom gets a Twitter account. #episode3rocks

— Andrew Wallenstein (@awallenstein) June 25, 2012

Soon Aaron Sorkin will write a show about people reacting to a new long-anticipated, critically panned TV show. Then you'll be sorry.

— Josh Greenman (@joshgreenman) June 25, 2012

Seriously, did they film this and then put it through the "make it look like crap in HD" filter? #Newsroom #everyonelooksawful

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 25, 2012

#TheNewsroom is sooooooo #Longread

— Rembert Browne (@rembert) June 25, 2012

Gotta hand it to Sorkin. I was expecting many crap things about The Newsroom, but "boring" was not one of them. The man can still surprise!

— Joe Gross))) (@joegross) June 25, 2012

HAHA THE HERO CALLED THE ONE INDIAN GUY PUNJAB AND ASSUMED HE WAS THE IT GUY! GREAT STUFF! I LOVE THIS ANTIHERO! #thenewsroom

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) June 25, 2012

There aren't nearly enough phones ringing in this newsroom. @HBO #TheNewsroom

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) June 25, 2012

Wow, everyone assuming the girl can't write a memo. This show is special. #Newsroom

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 25, 2012

#twitterjoke #thenewsroom

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) June 25, 2012

"I am taking you SHOPPING!" - Lady To Other Lady, and no, I am not kidding. #thenewsroom

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) June 25, 2012

Newsroom women be shoppin'

— Emily Yoshida (@emilyyoshida) June 25, 2012

My advice: buy The Newsroom. http://t.co/L8ffSNLv Watch an episode every night the HBO thing is on. Enjoy good TV.

— Chanders (@Chanders) June 25, 2012

"I love lamp." - One Of The Newsgirls, Doesn't Matter Which One. #thenewsroom

— Tara Ariano (@TaraAriano) June 25, 2012

It's okay if I just watch "The Newsroom" and frown sadly, right? You guys won't mind if I don't live-tweet or anything?

— Joe Reid (@joereid) June 25, 2012

As someone who has seen a news room or two, I'm shocked at the lack of animal fisting on HBO's The Newsroom.

— Miles Kahn (@mileskahn) June 25, 2012

I liked the part of ‚ÄúThe Newsroom‚Äù when Newsroom said all the stuff about the things.

— Danny MacEachern (@MacEachernNL) June 25, 2012

I've been off Twitter for like 2 days and srsly everyone still hates the Newsroom? C'mon, don't slack on the backlash cycle, Internet.

— Emily Yoshida (@emilyyoshida) June 25, 2012

Hmmm... Some very good stuff with #TheNewsRoom, also some not so good stuff. I think Aaron Sorkin misses Tommy Schlamme.

— Shawn Ryan (@ShawnRyanTV) June 25, 2012

My expectations were not lowered enough for The Newsroom.

— Julie Hammerleüî® (@JulieHammerle) June 25, 2012

Snap Poll: Less realistic The Newsroom or Ides of March? Go!

— Dirk Lester (@Dirk2112) June 25, 2012

Despite advance notice that it's bad, everyone in my feed is watching THE NEWSROOM & saying, "It's bad." Hey, this milk is spoiled. Try it.

— Big Username Jeb Lund (@Mobute) June 25, 2012

#TheNewsroom could fly off the rails and I'll hate it. Who knows. But I wish there were more shows that at least TRIED to say something big.

— MavisGaryVEVO (@MisterMcCracken) June 25, 2012

Re: The #Newsroom: if I wanted to watch sanctimonious old men lie to me and oversimplify things I'd just watch the actual news

— Mü¶Érgan Johnson (@Poormojo) June 25, 2012

don't care abt The Newsroom, but curious: is there a journalist character in it who tweets incessantly about the TV he/she is watching?

— Ishaan Tharoor (@ishaantharoor) June 25, 2012

I have a fucking twitter account?

— Will McAvoy (@WillMcAvoyACN) June 25, 2012

Really looking forward to nine more weeks of Sorkinfreude. #newsroom

— TVWithoutPity (@TVWithoutPity) June 25, 2012

Watching HBOs #Newsroom. It should really be a play. A play we don't go and see.

— Emily Cutler (@CutlerEmily) June 25, 2012

Very Sorkin that "Newsroom" deals with news 2 years in the past since "Studio 60" talked about TV like it was 5 years earlier. #timely

— üéÑChris WilsonüéÑ (@realchriswilson) June 25, 2012

Never go Full Sorkin. #Newsroom

— Bryan Murphy (@Bryan_Murphy) June 25, 2012

Wake me up when Jane Fonda's character on #TheNewsroom gets a Twitter account. #episode3rocks

— Andrew Wallenstein (@awallenstein) June 25, 2012

If the drunk Sam Waterson character on THE NEWSROOM doesn't have a Twitter account by midnight, we've failed as a nation.

— Patton Oswalt (@pattonoswalt) June 25, 2012

Crisis averted RT @pattonoswalt If drunk Sam Waterson character on THE NEWSROOM doesnt have an account by midnight, we've failed as a nation

— Charlie Skinner (@iamdrunksam) June 25, 2012

I think it was smart to call it #thenewsroom instead of their original title, "The Importance Hallway."

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) June 25, 2012

Hot damn, that was dreadful in a glorious fist pump way. I want to celebrate it. #thenewsroom

— Blerg (@MediaObsessed) June 25, 2012

I'M SORKED IN

— Molly Lambert (@mollylambert) June 25, 2012

Man, people are giving The Newsroom so much shit they're starting a vacation fund for it.

— James Urbaniak (@JamesUrbaniak) June 25, 2012

What if Aaron Sorkin doesn't know what the word 'glib' means?

— Brandon McCarthy (@BMcCarthy32) June 25, 2012

"The Newsroom" is a very realistic show about a workplace where everybody has speeches written for them by Aaron Sorkin.

— Frank Conniff (@FrankConniff) June 25, 2012

You critics with Newsroom screeners better not spoil what happens to these "Tea Party" characters.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) June 25, 2012

HBO: It's not TV, it's TV about TV. #TheNewsroom

— Pat Holleman (@tgdfweb) June 25, 2012

So, #Newsroom: Is Aaron Sorkin ever going to get over his unresolved #SportsNight issues?

— Nick Campbell (@sononick) June 25, 2012

I fucking love Aaron Sorkin. I fucking loved #TheNewsroom pilot. Haters stay pressed.

— Wes Ambrecht (@iamwesley) June 25, 2012

Wow. So maybe Sorkin haters. I love all the big theatrical soapboxalogues. Sorry but I've drank the Sorkin Kool Aid.

— Kevin Williamson (@kevwilliamson) June 25, 2012

Besides the obvious, are there worse things tonight than being dismissed as a Sorkin "hater"?

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) June 25, 2012

#notes #newsroom You can't be unpleasant and unattractive. Pick your pitfall.
